original_title: Richmond: Old Mill Road - Richmond Hill Road
text:
(1)
Old Mill Road, south side, at Richmond Hill Road, showing St. Andrews Protestant Episcopal Church, founded
in 1708 by Queen Anne.
About 1910

BY Mulford Simonson
From P.L. Sperr Collection.

(2)
The south side of the church, seen from Richmond Hill
Road.
May 1932

P.L. Sperr

(3)
The same as view 2.
1936

W.P.A. photo.
Federal Writers' Project.

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Hill Road - Mill Road
text:
Richmond Hill Road, north side, at the head of Mill Road, showing part of the old Latourette farm. The property later became part of Latourette Park.

About 1910

By Mulford Simonson
From P. L. Sperr Collection

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Hill Road - Mill Road
text:
Richmond Hill Road, north side at the head of Mill Road, showing part of the Latourette farm. This area later became part of Latourette Park.

About 1910
Views 1,2

By Mulford Simonson
From P. L. Sperr Collection

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Hill Road - Mill Road
text:

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Hill Road - Old Mill Road
text:
(1)
Richmond Hill Road, east side, near Old Mill Road (vantage point). Shown is a view of Richmond Hill, looking northeastward, with the Staten Island Light (Ambrose Channel Light) appearing in the center background.

By Mulford Simonson
From P. L. Sperr Collection

(2)
Part of the same area, nearer the lighthouse.

By Mulford Simonson
From P. L. Sperr Collection

About 1910
About 1910

text:

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Hill Road - Old Mill Road
text:
Richmond Hill Road, near Old Mill Road (vantage point). Shown is part of Richmond Hill in an autumn setting, in back of the old St. Andrews Church. View 2 shows a part of Richmond Hill, above the Staten Island Lighthouse, with mulberry trees appearing on the left.

About 1910
Views 1,2

By Mulford Simonson
From P. L. Sperr Collection

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Hill Road - Old Mill Road
text:
Richmond Hill Road, near Old Mill Road (vantage point). Shown is part of Richmond Hill in an autumn setting, in back of the old St. Andrews Church. View 2 shows a part of Richmond Hill, above the Staten Island Lighthouse, with mulberry trees appearing on the left.

About 1910
Views 1,2

By Mulford Simonson
From P. L. Sperr Collection

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Hill Road - Mill Road
text:
Richmond Hill Road, west from near Mill Road, in Latourette Park. In the distance can be seen Arthur Kill.

By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
December 18, 1913

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Hill Road - Mill Road
text:
Latourette Park (Staten IIsland): A view of the Datorette House, on the north side of Richmond Hill Road, at the head of Mill Road. This is the later lLatourette house; another house
stood farther south along Mill Road.
.March 5, 1922
By William T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same, at a later date.
May 18, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(3)
Another view from a different angle.
June 20, 1937
P. L. Sperr

original_title: Richmond: Old Mill Road - Richmond Hill Road
text:
(1)
Old Mill Road, south side, at Richmond Hill Road, showing St. Andrews Protestant Episcopal Church, established by Queen Anne in 1708.
1923

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same, two years later.
September 19, 1925

P. L. Sperr

(3)
An extensive view of the front of the church and the graveyard.

P. L. Sperr

1932

text:

Old Mill Road, south side, at Richmond Hill Road, showing St. Andrews P. E. Church, established in 1708 by Queen Anne. This is the south side of the church.
1923

original_title: Richmond: Old Mill Road - Richmond Hill Road
text:
(1)
Old Mill Road, south side, at Richmond Hill Road, showing the St. Andrews Protestant Episcopal Church. The view is southeastward across Old Mill Road.

P. L. Sperr
December 27, 1926

(2)
Another view of the church and graveyard. Also shown is part of Richmond Village.

P. L. Sperr
April 26, 1928

(3)
An additional view.

P. L. Sperr
May, 1932

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Hill Road - Old Mill Road
text:
Richmond Hill Road, east side, at Old Mill Road, showing the abandoned old Public School No. 28. It occupies the site of the Whipping Post, removed in 1825. A new P. S. 28 was erected at the S. W. corner of Center Street and St. Patricks Place.

April 26, 1928

P. L. Sperr

original_title: Richmond: Old Mill Road - Richmond Hill Road
text:
(1)
Old Mill Road south side, at Richmond Hill Road, showing St. Andrews Portestant Episcopal Church established by Queen Anne in 1708. This is the east side of the church seen from Richmond Hill Road.
May, 1932

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same another view.
May, 1932

P. L. Sperr

(3)
A more extensive view, across Richmond Hill Road.
May, 1932

P. L. Sperr
